info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 11:34PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Vernon Parish in west central Louisiana and northeastern Newton Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1134 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burr Ferry, or 8 miles southeast of Toledo Bend Dam, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... De Ridder, Leesville, Newton, Rosepine, Toledo Bend Dam, Burkeville, Fort Polk, New Llano, Farrsville, Burr Ferry, Mayflower, Stringtown, Wiergate, Evans and Pickering. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
